history.text: Hi there! Have you seen Bruce Almighty?
Hi, I Have seen Bruce Almighty. I thought it was a funny movie.
Oh cool. I haven't seen it. Although, somehow Morgan Freeman as God seems to make sense. Lol
Morgan Freeman has such a great voice. I also love Jim Carrey.
I do really adore Jim Carrey. I'm not sure why I didn't see this movie.
And yes, Morgan Freeman's voice is amazing.
Jennifer Aniston is great too.
She is. I like her a lot.
I was just seeing though, the Rotten tomatoes score is only 48%, but CinemaScore gave it an A? That seems vastly different.
I'm wondering if the CinemaScore is more a user review and Rotton is based on the critics.
It looks like the critical response was bad.
It's possible. I don't know much about either platform. And yes, looking at the comments from critics it didn't seem popular. But, I'm not sure comedies ever really are.
My favorite part of the movie is that it has Steve Carell in it.
Oh awesome! I love him.
yes, he plays Evan Baxter in this movie
It's been... 15 years since this was released? Ouch. I'm old.
I know. 2003 doesn't even seem that long ago
It doesn't. Was Jennifer Aniston good?
Yeah, I think she did pretty well in this movie. It's amazing to think that she was young in this movie too.
Crazy to think about for sure. Lol. Evan sounds like not a great guy based on this.
Evan and Bruce have some conflict in this movie for sure, but I think they see past it at the end
It's hard for me to imagine Steve Carell in another type of role because I loved him in The Office. Do you think his character is different in this film?
It's a more serious character for sure.
I love his character in the Office. He's a good comedic actor.
He is. Lol, wait... Bruce discovers the body of Jimmy Hoffa??
ya Bruce is able to make things turn out perfectly for him to get the best storires on his news show
Wow. I feel like I would've laughed at that. It says he prays and then ends up in the hospital. Does the movie show what happens to get him in the hospital?
I honestly don't remember. I think maybe he gets hit by a car.
But survies and everything is all good. lol
Interesting. I was just curious. What does the sign say at the end?
It's been a while since I've seen the movie to remember that detail
Well I also misread. I thought the sign just had one message on there but it looks like maybe there were several.
but the homeless man turns out to be God, AKA Morgan Freeman
And somehow that makes complete sense. Morgan Freeman sort of seems like he could just suddenly be like, "Fooled you!"
ya, he makes a good God charactor

uid1response.feedback: They didn't say anything before leaving so I'm not sure if we did the full task or not.
